Founders deal with a lot of pressure and stress, part of the gig. Here’s some tips…

1. Get a CEO coach
2. Find mentors
3. Celebrate your wins
4. Have fun & laugh often
5. Positive perspective

Feeling lost when searching for new startup ideas? 

Here’s a tip that helps me: 💡

Jot down the unnecessarily hard things you’ve done in the last 2 years 

And see if you can help others skip steps or suffer less 

People will pay premium

optimizations are irrelevant at the extremes:

- top/bottom performers don't need productivity hacks
- kindest/most evil don't need moral guidance
- best/worst startups don't need fundraising tips

Pro tip: having a Slack channel solely for people to shout out good news is just an example of one small thing that can make a major impact. Startups, take note. 🤝

💡 Hiring tip for early-stage startup founders

Look for people who are chasing "great learning potential" and the opportunity to "lead X function" in the organization.

These are people who are driven and focused on personal growth, and thus are likely to help you grow.

Want to start a (side) project, but don't have ideas? 

1. Avoid using "AI" idea generation tools. Those don't indicate the demand
2. Take your favorite CLI tool or an API and wrap it into a decent UI. That's it, make profit.
3. Avoid falling into the twitter startup tips trap

Startup tip to spend less, ship faster your MVP! 🚀

📂 Idea
   ∟📂 MVP
      ∟📂 Code 
          ∟ ❌ Don't directly think of this
      ∟📂 Nocode 
         ∟ ✅ Ship faster
